Skip to Content   Skip to Search   Skip to Navigation   Skip to Sub Navigation                                                             New York University College of Dentistry                                   Search NYUCD                                                                                                                       Main Navigation                                       About                                              Admissions/Academic Programs                                              Departments/Faculty                                              Research                                              Student Life                                              Alumni                                                                       CDE                                                            Global Reach                                              Patients                                               CDE > US Clinical Participation            Implantology                              upcoming continuing education events                                         go to calendar                                                                                                     Surgical and Prosthetic Treatment   This comprehensive, multi-disciplinary course will meet approximately 60 sessions over a two-year period. Participants can expect to complete surgical and prosthetic treatment on four patients. Patients are provided by New York University College of Dentistry. To register for this program, please call Jarett J. Gilbert, Director, at (212) 998-9757.   What you'll learn:          Textbook & Literature Review   Case Presentations   Diagnosis & Patient Work-up with Experienced Faculty            Treatment Planning Utilizing Advanced CT Software   Non-traumatic Extractions   Socket Preservation Grafting            Implant Placement & 2nd Stage Surgeries   Guided Tissue Regeneration   Fixed & Removable Implant Prosthetics           Two-Year Program: September 2014 - June 2016   Participants will be assigned to one of the following sessions:        Session I  Session II  Session III  Session IV  Session V        Monday  Monday  Wednesday  Wednesday  Thursday        8:30 am - 1:15 pm  11:45 am - 4:30 pm  8:30 am - 1:15 pm  11:45 am - 4:30 pm  8:30 am - 1:15 pm         Program Director     Dr. Trevor Bavar   ASSOCIATE DIRECTORS   Dr. Spyridon Condos (Monday)  Dr. Robert Bagoff (Wednesday)  Dr. Robert Friedman and Dr. David Kim (Thursday)                                                     Click flyer above to learn more and complete the Registration Form, which has fillable fields. Form must be downloaded (ie, saved on your computer), then opened with Adobe Acrobat. After filling in fields electronically on the downloaded file, select "File > Send" and email the completed form to dentalcde@nyu.edu. Visit www.adobe.com to learn more about Adobe products. For additional information regarding uses and disclosure of your health information please see our Notice of Privacy Practices (PDF).   Commitment to Inclusiveness: The Student Health Center is committed to providing quality care to all members of the NYU community who rely on our service. We recognize that race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, culture and socio-economic status may affect the health of an individual and/or influence an individual's healthcare choices. With that in mind, we strive to be sensitive to the diverse needs at NYU. Our commitment is to treat patients with respect, compassion, and sensitivity. Medical Records:       Authorization for Release of Health Information (PDF)   Authorization for Release of Counseling Information (PDF)   Authorization for Release of Medical Information and Confidential HIV-Related Information (PDF)   Authorization for Treatment of a Minor (PDF)     Patient Accounts:   Application for Medical Emergency Funding   Available for Full-time Graduate and Professional students only.     Student Health Insurance:       Insurance Enrollment/Waiver (Student Health Insurance Enrollment/Waiver is an online process)                                       Health Requirements Health Requirements for all NYU Students              Health Records     Health Information Management Services  726 Broadway, 3rd Floor  New York, NY 10003-9580   Phone: (212) 443-1272   Fax: (212) 443-1002   Email: health.hims@nyu.edu   To Request a Copy of Your Health Record:   Your health records are maintained in compliance with both federal and New York State laws.   If you are a new patient and have an on-going medical condition (e.g. diabetes, epilepsy, heart disease, allergies, etc.), it is important that we have a summary of your medical history to provide you with the best possible care.   You may send the information to Health Information Management Services (HIMS) at the address above for inclusion in your confidential health record.*   *Please ensure that this information is identified with your name, date of birth, and student I.D. number.   If you are under 18 years of age:   For students under 18 years of age, a parental or legal guardian authorization for medical treatment form must be on file in our office in order for you to receive prompt care and treatment, should the need arise. Please complete and return the Authorization for Treatment of a Minor (PDF) form to the address above.   To Request a Copy of Your Health Record:  If you wish to obtain a copy of your health record, you must submit a written request to the HIMS Office. You may use the request form Authorization for Release of Health Information (PDF) for a printable copy. All information must be completed in order for your request to be processed.   PLEASE NOTE: If you are requesting copies of x-ray examinations, HIMS can provide you with copies of written results of your x-rays. if you need copies of your radiology films, you must contact Radiology Services directly at (212) 443-1072.   HIV/AIDS:   If your health records contain information relating to HIV or AIDS, the New York State Department of Health requires a special authorization form - Authorization for Release of Confidential HIV Related Information (PDF). You may visit our department and complete the necessary forms on-site or you may fax or mail your completed request form to our department.   FEES for copies of Health Records:   Health records will be sent to another healthcare provider free of charge as a professional courtesy. However, records not going directly to another healthcare provider are copied at the rate of 75 cents per page. Health records will be released upon payment of all fees. If you have any questions regarding the release of your health records, please contact the HIMS Correspondence Unit at (212) 443-1272.
